subject: Sales
title: Catalogues: Selling to Remote America
description: A fast breakdown of Catalogues: Selling to Remote America for builders.

hook.text: Sears mailed his first catalogue in 1888. Farmers who'd never seen a city store could suddenly buy anything.

buildup.text: Mail-order catalogues brought retail to isolated areas. The Sears catalogue became the 'wish book.'

discovery.text: For millions, the catalogue was the sole connection to modern goods. It democratized consumption entirely.

twist.text: Catalogues trained consumers to buy without touching goods â€” the exact skill e-commerce later required.

climax.text: From Sears to Amazon, the core idea endures: bring the store to the customer, not the reverse.

punchline.text: The catalogue was e-commerce a century early.

quiz.question: How did mail-order catalogues prepare consumers for e-commerce?
options: They trained people to buy without physically touching products
